sections.title: Managing the Project with SDLC
sections.content: While creating that project I used use SDLC steps to create a manageable and scalable project. Let's start

sections.title: 1 - Requirements Gathering & Analysis
checklistItems: Identifying the project's scope.
Gathering requirements for the UI toolkit based on project needs.
Researching potential users' needs and preferences regarding UI/UX.
Creating github issues for each requirement

sections.title: 2 - Design
checklistItems: Comparing the possible UI toolkits and libraries based on the requirements
Finalizing the choice of UI toolkit.
Designing the application architecture.
Creating wireframes and mockups.

sections.title: UI Toolkit Comparison: Mantine UI, Material UI, and Chakra UI

rows.Material UI: Extensive customization but can be more complex.
Good, but can be heavy for complex applications.
rows.Chakra UI: Balanced performance, good for dynamic UIs.

rows.Mantine UI: Simple API and easy to learn.
rows.Material UI: Steep learning curve due to comprehensive features.
rows.Chakra UI: Intuitive API, easy to use and learn.

rows.Material UI: Large community, extensive resources and support.
rows.Chakra UI: Strong community, good documentation and support.

rows.Mantine UI: Focus on accessibility with ARIA support.
rows.Chakra UI: Good accessibility features and best practices.

rows.Material UI: Responsive design is a core feature.

rows.Mantine UI: Increasing popularity, newer in the market.

rows.Chakra UI: Easy theming, focus on composition and flexibility.

sections.title: UI Toolkit Decision

decisions.name: Mantine UI
decisions.description: offers a balance between customization, ease of use, and performance, making it a strong candidate for projects prioritizing developer experience and speed.

decisions.name: Material UI
decisions.description: is suited for applications that benefit from Material Design and require a comprehensive suite of components.

decisions.name: Chakra UI
decisions.description: is ideal for projects that emphasize accessibility, simplicity, and ease of theming.

sections.conclusion: As I am the only developer in the current project, I will choose the one which can be learned easily. So that after inspecting its Table component and other ready-to-go custom hooks, Mantine UI is my choice.

sections.title: 3 - Development (Implementation)
checklistItems: Setting up the development environment.
Creating the UI toolkit components.
Configuring Next.js, TypeScript and the chosen libraries
Implementing the application's architecture.
Implementing the frontend features according to the design mockups.
Creating a responsive and accessible design.

sections.title: 4 - Testing
checklistItems: Creating unit tests for the UI toolkit components.
Testing the application's responsiveness and accessibility.
Performing usability testing with potential users.

sections.title: 5 - Deployment
checklistItems: Setting up the deployment environment. (Vercel)
Deploying the application to a staging environment. (You are here already)
Performing user acceptance testing.
Deploying the application to production.

sections.title: 6 - Maintenance (Goes on...)
checklistItems: Monitoring the application's performance and user feedback.
Performing regular maintenance and updates.
Addressing any issues and bugs that arise.
Gathering feedback for future improvements.
